articles.headline: Jailed by the Thousands, Without Charges, to Act as Witnesses
articles.snippet: The Justice Department has invoked a 200-year-old law to detain thousands of undocumented immigrants as witnesses in smuggling cases. Judges have locked up some for six months or more.
articles.abstract: The Justice Department has invoked a 200-year-old law to detain thousands of undocumented immigrants as witnesses in smuggling cases. Judges have locked up some for six months or more.
articles.lead_paragraph: Several months ago, as a federal judge worked through a docket of smuggling cases in the bustling border city of Laredo, Texas, three people were escorted into the courtroom.
articles.byline: By Sarah Cutler, Steve Eder and Robert Gebeloff

articles.headline: Spotify Gave Subscribers Music and Podcasts. Next: Audiobooks.
articles.snippet: A year after adding à la carte sales of audiobooks, Spotify is offering paying subscribers 15 hours of books a month.
articles.abstract: A year after adding à la carte sales of audiobooks, Spotify is offering paying subscribers 15 hours of books a month.
articles.lead_paragraph: Four years ago, Spotify’s business was stagnating. Apple had overtaken it as the top paid music service in the United States, losses were mounting and customer growth was slowing.
articles.byline: By Alexandra Alter and Tripp Mickle

articles.headline: McCarthy’s Extraordinary Downfall Reflects an Ungovernable G.O.P.
articles.snippet: The glib Californian made many promises and paid a price when he was unable to fulfill them. But his demise also reflected the challenge of wielding a Republican majority that refuses to be governed.
articles.abstract: The glib Californian made many promises and paid a price when he was unable to fulfill them. But his demise also reflected the challenge of wielding a Republican majority that refuses to be governed.
articles.lead_paragraph: Kevin McCarthy did two things right, but too many other things wrong.

articles.headline: The 8-Year-Old Boy at the Heart of a Fight Over Tibetan Buddhism
articles.snippet: He may have to defend the faith in Mongolia against pressure from China’s ruling Communist Party.
articles.abstract: He may have to defend the faith in Mongolia against pressure from China’s ruling Communist Party.
articles.lead_paragraph: The boy had seemed destined for a life of affluence and earthly pursuits. Born into the family behind a major mining conglomerate in Mongolia, he might have been picked to someday lead the company from its steel-and-glass headquarters in the country’s capital.

articles.headline: China’s Top Art Investor Amassed a Big Collection. Now He’s Selling.
articles.snippet: Liu Yiqian made global headlines in 2014 and 2015 by paying top prices for paintings and antiquities but is starting to liquidate part of his collection.
articles.abstract: Liu Yiqian made global headlines in 2014 and 2015 by paying top prices for paintings and antiquities but is starting to liquidate part of his collection.
articles.lead_paragraph: Few Chinese art collectors have made a bigger splash at global auctions in the past decade than Liu Yiqian, a former Shanghai taxi driver who amassed a fortune through big bets on Chinese real estate and pharmaceutical stocks.

articles.headline: A ‘Shadow’ Lending Market in the U.S., Funded by Insurance Premiums
articles.snippet: Apollo was the first to use annuities to build a major financing business. Others followed, driving the growth of the private lending market and worrying regulators.
articles.abstract: Apollo was the first to use annuities to build a major financing business. Others followed, driving the growth of the private lending market and worrying regulators.
articles.lead_paragraph: In 2009, as the banking business was on the verge of being reshaped by new regulations in the wake of the great financial crisis, the private equity giant Apollo Global Management found a way to make money off the retirement savings of millions of everyday Americans.

articles.headline: Giuliani’s Drinking, Long a Fraught Subject, Has Trump Prosecutors’ Attention
articles.snippet: The former mayor’s drinking has become an investigative subplot in Donald Trump’s federal case over 2020 election interference. But long before that, friends had grown deeply concerned.
articles.abstract: The former mayor’s drinking has become an investigative subplot in Donald Trump’s federal case over 2020 election interference. But long before that, friends had grown deeply concerned.
articles.lead_paragraph: Rudolph W. Giuliani had always been hard to miss at the Grand Havana Room, a magnet for well-wishers and hangers-on at the Midtown cigar club that still treated him like the king of New York.
articles.byline: By Matt Flegenheimer and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Scalise and Jordan Announce Bids for Speaker as Vacancy Paralyzes the House
articles.snippet: Representatives Steve Scalise of Louisiana and Jim Jordan of Ohio are both running to succeed Kevin McCarthy, who was ousted as speaker.
articles.abstract: Representatives Steve Scalise of Louisiana and Jim Jordan of Ohio are both running to succeed Kevin McCarthy, who was ousted as speaker.
articles.lead_paragraph: The second-ranking House Republican and the chairman of the Judiciary Committee on Wednesday both announced their campaigns for speaker, setting the stage for a bruising struggle pitting some of the most conservative G.O.P. leaders against one another.
articles.byline: By Carl Hulse and Luke Broadwater

articles.headline: City of Light or City of Bites? France Tries to Ease Bedbug Anxiety.
articles.snippet: With less than a year to go before millions are expected in Paris for the Olympics, a wave of widely publicized reports of bedbug infestations has put French authorities under pressure.
articles.abstract: With less than a year to go before millions are expected in Paris for the Olympics, a wave of widely publicized reports of bedbug infestations has put French authorities under pressure.
articles.lead_paragraph: In France’s lower house of Parliament, a top opposition lawmaker held up a small vial for all her colleagues to see. Its contents, she warned in a fiery speech this week, were “spreading despair” around the country.

articles.headline: It’s Time to Pay Your Student Loans. What Happens if You Fall Behind?
articles.snippet: Missed payments will be reported as a forbearance rather than as delinquencies. But your credit score could still be affected.
articles.abstract: Missed payments will be reported as a forbearance rather than as delinquencies. But your credit score could still be affected.
articles.lead_paragraph: With federal student loan payments due again for the first time in nearly four years, financially stretched borrowers may be concerned about the consequences of missed payments.
